 ##########

     fi
     pushd release

 Review comment:

emkornfield commented on pull request #5807: ARROW-6799: [Plasma] Fix plasma_java build
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5807#discussion_r346138677
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/plasma/test.sh
 ##########
 @@ -47,10 +47,10 @@ pushd ../../cpp
             -DARROW_WITH_ZSTD=off \
             -DARROW_PLASMA_JAVA_CLIENT=on \
             ..
-        make VERBOSE=1 -j$PARALLEL
+        sudo make VERBOSE=1 -j$PARALLEL
     popd
 popd
 
 mvn clean install
-export PLASMA_STORE=$ROOT_DIR/../../cpp/release/release/plasma_store_server
-java -cp target/test-classes:target/classes -Djava.library.path=$ROOT_DIR/../../cpp/release/release/ org.apache.arrow.plasma.PlasmaClientTest
+export PLASMA_STORE=$CONDA_PREFIX/tmp/arrow/cpp/release/release/plasma-store-server
 
 Review comment:
   Its not clear to me that CONDA_PREFIX is the right thing to use here if this is intended as a development script.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: Does not appear to be tested in CI. Originally reported at https://github.com/apache/arrow/issues/5575
fields.summary: [C++] Plasma JNI component links to flatbuffers::flatbuffers (unnecessarily?)

comments.body: As part of this we should make sure we have this component running in CI
Should we just delete the plasma jni implementation? It seems like it was never finished and no one is maintaining it?
If it's not being maintained then I agree we should delete it
What criteria are we using for "maintained"?  There might be some other code that would fall into this category (ORC JNI support comes to mind).

I just opened ARROW-7534 to create a contrib module and demote these things to their. I think that if we don't have development or user engagement on a contrib module for two quarters (or something like that), it should probably be thought of as "no longer used/maintained".
This is no longer an issue because Flatbuffers is not in our toolchain anymore
